text: Deborah Kerr CBE (30 September 1921 â€“ 16 October 2007) was a British actress. She was born Deborah Jane Kerr-Trimmer in Glasgow, Scotland. She won a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress for her starring role as Anna Leonowens in The King and I. Kerr died of Parkinson's disease in Botesdale, Suffolk. == Other websites == * Category:1921 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Actors from Glasgow Category:Actresses who played Bond girls Category:Disease-related deaths in England Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Scottish movie actors Category:Scottish stage actors Category:Scottish television actors
title: Deborah Kerr
